intro: Gilia peninsularis, commonly known as the Peninsular Gilia, is a flowering plant native to the Baja California Peninsula. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Gilia peninsularis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray.
